Bases: ModelForm

This is a class that will create a event form for my website. It will be used to ask the user to input details about the event they wan to book, details such as: name of the event, evet date, maager of the event, attendees of the event etc.

This is a class that will create a Venue form for my website. The form will ask for: venue name, address, zip code, phone number, web address, and email address.

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

attendees

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

description

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

event_date

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

get_next_by_event_date(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: event_date>, is_next=True, **kwargs)
get_previous_by_event_date(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: event_date>, is_next=False, **kwargs)

venue

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

events.urls module

events.views module

events.views.add_event(request)[source]

This function will allow the user to add an event using the event form. If the request method is POST, and if the details entered are all valid, save the form and store in the database.

Parameters:

request (Any) – will be used to determine if the method is POST or GET

Returns:

render the add_event.html

Return type:

render request

events.views.add_venue(request)[source]

This function will allow the user to add a new venue. If the request method is post, it will call the Venue form and allow the user to fill in the details, if all the details are valid, save the form and post it to the database

Returns:

will redirect the user to thier submiited form

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

Returns:

will load the add_venue.html file

Return type:

render

events.views.all_events(request)[source]

This function will display all the events that have been submiited in a readable manner on the website.

Returns:

it will load the event_list.html file and will get all the events in the database and display it here

Return type:

render

events.views.home(request, year=2023, month='February')[source]

This function will display a calendar on the home page of the website, it will autmatically update each month for every year.

Parameters:

  • year (int) – this will use the datetime module to get the current year

  • month (str) – this will also use the datetime module to get the curret month

Returns:

it will return a calendar showing the current month and the days with the current year on the home page

RtypeL:

render

events.views.list_venues(request)[source]

This function returns all the venues in a readable manner on the website.

Returns:

loads the venues.html file

Return type:

render

events.views.update_venue(request, venue_id)[source]

This function will allow the user to update a venue. It will fetch the Venue form using the Venues id number. If the form details are valid, save the changes.

Parameters:

venue_id (int) – the id number for the venue in the database

Returns:

redirects you back to the url called list-venues

Return type:

redirect

Returns:

loads the update_venue.html file

Return type:

render
